STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 29, 2020
Michelle Horn
42nd Circuit Court - Family Division
3712 E Ashman Street
Midland, MI 48642
RE: License #: CA560234172
42nd Circuit Court - Family Division
3712 E Ashman Street
Midland, MI 48642
Dear Ms. Horn:
Your Child Placing Agency certificate of authorization license is renewed. It is valid only
at your present address and is nontransferable. If you move, please notify us at least
30 days in advance.
You will be receiving the certificate of authorization license in the mail. Please review it
for accuracy.
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
07/29/2020. You have submitted an acceptable written corrective action plan covering
the violations cited in the report. It should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes
and rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. Your certificate of
authorization is renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 284-9720.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make
a licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
Two of the three foster home records reviewed contained documentation to indicate
the recommendation to the department (3706) for the renewal of the license was not
submitted at least 15 calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license. In the first example the license had an expiration date of 03/19/2020 and
the recommendation (3706) submitted was signed 03/09/2020. In the second
example the license had an expiration date of 05/25/20 and the recommendation
(3706) was signed 05/20/2020. The delay for the second example was related to
barriers associated with COVID-19 restrictions/conditions.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that there
are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in section
The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
None required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
None required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
AND
4

The agency has not submitted any acceptable corrective action plans not
related to maltreatment during this licensing period.
None have been required. There were no violations in the interim evaluation
completed 09/24/2019 or the renewal evaluation completed 07/20/2018.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. An
acceptable corrective action plan has been received. It is recommended that the facility
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
07/29/2020
